Common Cold: Rest, drink plenty of fluids, use saline nasal sprays. Honey can soothe sore throat (not for infants). Symptoms usually improve in 7-10 days.
Influenza: Rest in bed, stay hydrated, isolate to avoid spreading. Over-the-counter fever reducers if needed. Seek doctor if high fever or breathing issues.
Bronchitis: Rest, hydrate, use humidifier. Avoid smoking/irritants. Cough may last weeks â€” see doctor if worsening.
Gastroenteritis: Focus on hydration (oral rehydration solutions). Eat bland foods when able. Wash hands to prevent spread.
Migraine: Rest in dark/quiet room, cold compress, stay hydrated. Avoid triggers like certain foods/stress.
Eczema: Moisturize frequently with fragrance-free cream. Avoid harsh soaps/triggers. Cool compress for itch.
default: Rest, stay hydrated, eat light meals, monitor symptoms closely. Seek medical help if symptoms worsen, persist >7 days, or you feel seriously ill.
